etymology.description: 大 + 白菜 = big/large + Chinese cabbage → the large napa variety.
etymology.interpretation: Literally “big cabbage”, marking the broad, pale-headed napa type as opposed to 小白菜 (pak choi). In northern usage, 大白菜 commonly just refers to napa cabbage.

parts.english: Chinese cabbage; napa cabbage; leafy greens; cabbage

examples.chinese: 我买了两棵大白菜(我買了兩棵大白菜)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ mǎi le liǎng kē dà báicài.
examples.english: I bought two heads of Chinese cabbage.

examples.chinese: 冬天炖大白菜很家常(冬天燉大白菜很家常)。
examples.pinyin: Dōngtiān dùn dà báicài hěn jiācháng.
examples.english: Braising Chinese cabbage in winter is very home-style.

examples.chinese: 北方人常把大白菜腌成酸菜(北方人常把大白菜醃成酸菜)。
examples.pinyin: Běifāng rén cháng bǎ dà báicài yān chéng suāncài.
examples.english: People in the north often pickle Chinese cabbage into suancai.
